name: Iron Maiden: What Lyrics Are These? Quiz | Music | 25 Questions

questions.text: 'If you're feeling down, depressed and lonely, I know a place where we can go.'
questions.explanation:
22 Acacia Avenue.

	Taken from the album 'The Number of the Beast', released in 1982. The song is about a continuing Iron Maiden theme regarding a character called Charlotte the Harlot.

questions.text: 'I've found that I like this living in danger. Living on the edge, it makes me feel as one. Who cares now what's right or wrong. It's reality.'
questions.explanation:
Lord of the Flies.

	Taken from the album 'The X Factor', released in 1995. This track is one of the most vigorous on the album, with plenty of energy throughout.

questions.text: 'So get down on your knees honey, assume an attitude, you just pray that I'll be waiting, 'cos you know I'm coming soon.'
questions.explanation:
Bring your Daughter...to the Slaughter

	Taken from the album 'No Prayer for the Dying', released in 1990. This song hit the UK charts at No.1 when it was released.

questions.text: 'Trace your way back 50 years, to the glow of Dresden, blood and tears.'
questions.explanation:
Tailgunner.

	Taken from the album 'No Prayer for the Dying', released in 1990. 'Tailgunner' is a story about World War II.

questions.text: 'All my hopes and expectation, looking for an explanation, have I found my destination? I just can't take no more.'
questions.explanation:
Dream of Mirrors.

	Taken from the album 'Brave New World', released in 2000. Iron Maiden recorded this album in a theater at the same time, setting up their instruments in different corners of the room.

questions.text: 'Fight wars, die in a blaze of glory. Come home, meat in a plastic sack. Fall down, better pray to your god for mercy.'
questions.explanation:
Judas be my Guide.

	Taken from the album 'Fear of the Dark', released in 1992.

questions.text: 'See, onward she comes, onward she nears, out of the sun. See, she has no crew, she has no life, wait but here's two.'
questions.explanation:
Rime of the Ancient Mariner.

	Taken from the album 'Powerslave', released in 1984.

questions.text: 'You're standing in the wings, then you wait for the curtain to fall. Knowing the terror and holding you have on us all.'
questions.explanation:
Phantom of the Opera.

	Taken from the debut album 'Iron Maiden', released in 1980.

questions.text: 'I'm waiting in my cold cell, when the bell begins to chime.'
options: The Thin Line Between Love and Hate
questions.explanation:
Hallowed be thy Name.

	Taken from the album 'The Number of the Beast', released in 1982.

questions.text: 'I have a constant fear that something's always near.'
questions.explanation:
Fear of the Dark.

	Taken from the self-titled album 'Fear of the Dark', released in 1992.

questions.text: 'A knife at your throat another body on the pile, a contract to keep and it's service with a smile. Murder for vengeance or murder for gain, Death on the streets or a blackened out jail.'
questions.explanation:
Gangland.

	Taken from the album 'The Number of the Beast', released in 1982.

questions.text: 'My faith in believing is stronger than lifelines and ties, with the glimmer of metal my moment is ready to strike.'
questions.explanation:
Killers.

	"Killers" is the title track from Iron Maiden's 1981 album.

questions.text: 'The killing fields, the grinding wheels crushed by equilibrium. Separate lives no more disguise, no more second chances.'
questions.explanation:
Out of the Silent Planet.

	Taken from the album 'Brave New World', released in 2000.

questions.text: 'And then I heard a piercing scream and I rushed to the scene of the crime, but all I found was the butchered remains of two girls lay side by side.'
questions.explanation:
Murders in the Rue Morgue.

	Taken from the album 'Killers', released in 1981.

questions.text: 'But if you asked me a question, would I tell you the truth. Now there's something to bet on, you've got nothing to lose.'
questions.explanation:
No Prayer for the Dying.

	Taken from the self-titled album, released in 1990.

questions.text: 'Won't you come into my room, I wanna show you all my wares.'
questions.explanation:
Iron Maiden.

	Taken from the self-titled debut album, released in 1980.

questions.text: 'Can I tempt you, come with me, be Devil may care, fulfill your dream.'
questions.explanation:
Caught Somewhere in Time.

	Taken from the album 'Somewhere in Time', released in 1986.

questions.text: 'He's walking like a small child. But watch his eyes burn you away. Black holes in his golden stare. God knows he wants to go home.'
questions.explanation:
Children of the Damned.

	Taken from the album 'The Number of the Beast', released in 1982.

questions.text: 'They'll be coming to bring the eternal flame. They'll be bringing us all immortality.'
questions.explanation:
Sign of the Cross.

	Taken from the album 'The X Factor', released in 1995.

questions.text: 'Hold up your heads, be proud of what you are. Now it has come, freedom at last. Turning the tides of history, and your past.'
questions.explanation:
Mother Russia.

	Taken from the album 'No Prayer for the Dying', released in 1990.

questions.text: 'By the Tigris river, he met King Darius again, and crushed him again in the battle of Arbela. Entering Babylon and Susa, treasures he found, took Persepolis, the capital of Persia.'
questions.explanation:
Alexander the Great.

	Taken from the album 'Somewhere in Time', released in 1986.

questions.text: 'Are you scared to look inside your mind? Are worried just at what you'll find? Do you really want to face the truth? Does it matter now, what have you got to lose?'
questions.explanation:
The Unbeliever.

	Taken from the album 'The X Factor', released in 1995.

questions.text: 'Too much time on my hands, I got you on my mind. Can't ease this pain, so easily.'
options: The Loneliness of the Long Distance Runner
questions.explanation:
Wasted Years.

	Taken from the album 'Somewhere in Time', released in 1986.

questions.text: 'But I will pray for her, I will call her name out loud. I would bleed for her, if I could only see her now.'
questions.explanation:
The Evil that Men Do.

	Taken from the album 'Seventh Son of a Seventh Son', released in 1988.

questions.text: 'There goes the siren that warns of the air raid, then comes the sound of the guns sending flak.'
questions.explanation:
Aces High.

	Taken from the album 'Powerslave', released in 1984.
